p: Similarly, Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS)-CoV patients treated with steroids appeared to experience worse outcomes than those not given steroids, including sustained viral replication, increased need for mechanical ventilation, vasoconstrictors, and renal replacement therapy, and a higher mortality rate. However, after statistical correction for some biases and confounders, steroid therapy was not found to be associated with 90-day mortality ( Arabi et al., 2018).
